intro: Sticherus perpaleaceus, commonly known as the pale leaf sticherus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
